questions.text: During a nutrition support team meeting, a dietitian highlights the critical importance of monitoring for refeeding syndrome in patients who are starting nutritional rehabilitation after a period of starvation or severe malnutrition. questions.text: A pediatric nutritionist is discussing the discharge criteria for children admitted with Severe Acute Malnutrition (SAM) at a regional health conference. She emphasizes the importance of ensuring that children have reached a certain threshold of recovery before they are discharged to continue outpatient care. According to international guidelines, a child with SAM is considered fit for discharge when which nutritional status indicator reaches a specific threshold?

options.label: A
options.text: Weight for Height reaches -2 SD or higher

options.label: B
options.text: Weight for Height reaches -3 SD or higher

options.label: C
options.text: Weight for Age reaches -2SD or higher

options.label: D
options.text: Height for Age reaches -2 SD or higher

questions.correct_answer: A. Weight for Height reaches -2 SD or higher
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Weight for Height reaches -2 SD or higher
